alert.note: Alert for Mississippi (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 5:53PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Mississippi County through 630 PM CDT... At 553 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Bassett, or near Wilson, moving north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Blytheville, Osceola, Manila, Luxora, Wilson, Keiser, Joiner, Dyess, Dell, Burdette, Bassett, Marie, Little River, Etowah, Victoria, Dearman, Eastview, Lennie, Evadale and Driver. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
